Based on the user's preference cues, I would recommend "Smokin' Aces" as a potential recommendation.
"Smokin' Aces" is a 2006 American biographical crime film directed by Alex Rocco. It stars Ben Gazzara, John Glover, and Christopher Keyes. The film is based on the non-fiction book of the same name written by Frank Gallo (1958- ) who was an associate of the mobster Lucky Luciano in New York City during the 1960s and also ran several gambling operations including the Stardust Club in Las Vegas Nevada where he met his future associates George "Mob" Armentano ("1932-2007") and Thomas "Tommy" Grimes ("1954- )", and Joseph "Joe" Valenti, who were all members of the Genovese crime family operating out of New York City during the 1960s.
